climbs.name: The Wine Drip
climbs.fa: Luke D., Greg M., Bobby G. & Megan P, 11/21/2005

content.description: Avoid the temptation to start off of the large boulder in the dry streambed.  The start from the ground is fun and bouldery.  Expect some jugs on a slightly overhanging face with a more technically demanding crux.  I didn't let any of my wine drip while climbing or belaying...
content.protection: 7 gray bolts to a 2 chain anchor.
content.location: Between Mad Swiller and Pump It Until Purple.  Fifth route from the left on the main wall.  Rappel from the 2 chain anchor.
1st climb on left side of gully

content.description: At first, it is easier than it looks, but don't get lulled into a false sense of security.  It gets steeper and thinner as you approach the crux.  **BETA ALERT** The crux is reachy and a hidden hold is key.  Expect to turn purple at the stance below the crux while trying to figure this one out.
content.protection: 6 gray bolts to a 2 chain anchor.
content.location: Between Bubbles & Booze and Mad Swiller.  Third route from the left on the main wall.  Rappel from a 2 chain anchor.

climbs.name: Purple Pumper
climbs.fa: Luke Douglas, Greg Martinez & Tyler Phillips, 11/5/2005

content.description: Best line on the wall.  Purple Pumper will puzzle you in places that will pump you if you're not persistent.  The first 15 feet are rotten but easy, from here on out it is pure pleasure.  There were some reachy moves, a lot of footwork, and even more balancing acts.  Absolutely worth the hike.
content.protection: 9 gray bolts to a two chain anchor shared with Purple Gurpel on the right.
content.location: Just right of the tree that grows beneath the jagged corner system that splits the Purple Wall.  This is the second route from the right.  Rappel from the two chain anchor.
2nd climb on left side of gully you come to about 40 yards down from bubbles & booze

climbs.name: Purple Gurpel
climbs.fa: Greg Martinez, Luke Douglas & Tyler Phillips, 11/25/2005

content.description: Purple Gurpel is almost as fun as Purple Pumper, but it suffers from rotten rock in places, and a weird cave with a bush growing out of it.  There is a fantastic-looking flake that was pretty loose.  I wonder how long it will last.  Purple Gurpel is a nice climb that will please those who make the hike.
content.protection: 7 gray bolts to a two chain anchor shared with Purple Pumper on the left.
content.location: First bolt line from the north (right).  Look for highest concentration of purple rock and you've found Purple Gurpel.  Rappel from the anchors.

climbs.name: Pump It Until Purple
climbs.fa: Greg M., Luke D., Bobby G. & Megan P, 11/21/2005

content.description: Warm up on Pump It Until Purple.  It will give you a taste of what to expect on other climbs on the Purple Wall.  It is just a little steep, and a little bit pumpy too.  My arms didn't turn purple when they got pumped, maybe I was doing something wrong...
content.protection: 6 gray bolts to a 2 chain anchor.
content.location: A small tree grows underneath a broken corner system that splits the wall.  Pump It Until Purple is the first climb to the left of the tree.  Rappel off of the 2 chain anchor.

content.description: So far, this is my favorite route on the wall.  Expect some steep and pumpy jug hauling with a balancey crux.  I'll admit that I was swilling water like a mad man after sending this route...
content.location: Between Squeeze It Until It's Purple and The Wine Drip.  Fourth route from the left on the main wall.  Rappel from the 2 chain anchor.

climbs.name: Gas Stoned
climbs.fa: sept 26 07 Mike Bird Greg M Clark Olsen Deanna Caradine Jeff Olsen

content.location: 4th climb on left side of gully. 1st climb on main wall left side.

climbs.name: Drop Out
climbs.fa: SEPT 26 07 Greg M Clark Olsen Deanna Caradine

content.protection: 8 bolts & same chains as purple haze
content.location: 3rd climb up gully on left. clip 3 1st bolts of purple haze then go left & up for 5 more bolts to purple haze chains

climbs.name: Collie Buddz
climbs.fa: oct  10 07 Mike Bird Greg M Brian Goody

content.location: 2nd climb on left side of gully

climbs.name: Bubbles & Booze
climbs.fa: Clark Olsen, Duncan Murray & Greg Martinez, 6/25/2006

content.description: Climb an easy face to an overhanging section that sports a thin crack at its base.  **BETA ALERT** Blast up the overhang on some thin and balancey holds to a jug, then make a wild traverse to a rail and get your feet up before you blow it.  Didn't bring any booze to celebrate my lackluster climbing, so I had to settle for blowing bubbles with my spit, how gross...
content.location: Second route on the left of the main wall.  Look for the black hangers.  Rappel from a two chain anchor.
